snippet: Levon Aronian dominated the Tata Steel Chess Tournament last week and may get a chance to take on the world titleholder, Magnus Carlsen, in the fall.
abstract: Dylan Loeb McClain Chess column holds that dominance of Armenian Levon Aronian at Tata Steel Chess Tournament in Netherlands shows that he is ready to challenge world champion Magnus Carlsen.
lead_paragraph: Levon Aronian dominated the Tata Steel Chess Tournament last week and may get a chance to take on the world titleholder, Magnus Carlsen, in the fall.

headline.main: World’s No. 2 Player Ready to Challenge for the Top Spot
headline.print_headline: World’s No. 2 Player Ready to Challenge for the Top Spot
